New York University Abu Dhabi Library
'A trip in Algeria' by H. E. Irving Taylor
Taylor, H.E. Irving
AD.MC.040
48 Photographic Prints Album, oblong 8vo (18.2 x 24.5 cm), pp. [2], 48; printed title 'The interchangeable photo-scrap album no trimming or mounting required' (London, M.W. & Co.), 48 black and white glossy prints (10.5 x 15.5 cm)
December 1901 – April 1902 A visual and written record of a trip to Algeria at the opening of the 20th century (48 images) undertaken by H.E. Irving Taylor and his travelling companion, Mr Shepherd, comprising Taylor's attractive, clear photographs alongside his engaging, well-written and enthusiastic accompanying narrative. Taylor and Shepherd's trip, undertaken in January 1902, took them to Algiers, Constantine, El Kantara, Biskra, Sidi Okba, Kherrata, and the Djurdjura mountain range, the pair travelling by train, trap, bicycle, camel, and on foot. AD_MC_040
Content Description
A visual and written record of a trip to Algeria at the opening of the 20th century (48 gelatin silver images) undertaken by H.E. Irving Taylor and his travelling companion, Mr Shepherd, comprising Taylor's attractive, clear photographs alongside his engaging, well-written and enthusiastic accompanying narrative. Taylor and Shepherd's trip, undertaken in January 1902, took them to Algiers, Constantine, El Kantara, Biskra, Sidi Okba, Kherrata, and the Djurdjura mountain range, the pair travelling by train, trap, bicycle, camel, and on foot.
Biographical
From the Venn Catalogue of Alumni Cantabrigiensis: "Taylor, Henry Edward Irving. Adm. at PEMBROKE, Oct. 1894. 3rd s. of the Rev. Charles Johnson (St John's College, Oxford, 1843), of 'The Larches,' Banstead, Surrey . B. Aug. 24, 1867, at Folkestone. Schools [Blackheath proprietary; The Leys, Cambridge, and] Hanover Square School of electrical engineering and at the City and Guilds College, 1889-92. Employed by the L.B.&.S.C. Railway and at works in Camden Town before residence. Matric. Michs. 1894; B.A. 1897; M.A. 1905. Assistant Master at Crewkerne School, Somerset , 1897-8; private tutor, 1898-1903; Head Master of a private School in Surrey , 1903-32. Of Coolinge, Reigate, Surrey , where he died June 30, 1943. Brother of Decimus A. G. (1890) and Chapman C. A. (1884). ( City and Guilds Coll. Reg.; The Times, July 2, 1943.)"
"Henry Edward Irving TAYLOR Approx. lifespan: 1867–1943 Adm Pembroke College 1894:10 3rd s. of Rev. Charles Johnson TAYLOR ( St John's College [Oxford] (1843), of 'The Larches,' Banstead, Surrey , b. Folkestone, [Kent], 1867:08:24 Schools [Blackheath proprietary [Kent], The Leys, CB, [Cambridgeshire], Hanover Sch: Square School of electrical engineering [London], Sch: City and Sch: Guilds College City and Guilds, [London], 1889-92 Employed: by the L.B.&.S.C. Railway and at works Camden Town, [London], before residence. Matric 1894:10MT: BA 1897 MA 1905 Assistant Master at: : Sch: Crewkerne School Crewkerne, Somerset , 1897-98 private Tutor: 1898-1903 Headmaster of: : private School Surrey , 1903-32 Of Coolinge, Reigate, Surrey , d. 1943:06:30 brother of Decimus A. G. TAYLOR (1890) brother of Chapman C. A. TAYLOR (1884) ( City and Guilds College Reg.; The Times 1943:07:02)"
http://venn.lib.cam.ac.uk/cgi-bin/search-2018.pl?sur=Taylor&suro=w&fir=Henry+Edward+Irving&firo=w&cit=&cito=c&c=all&z=all&tex=&sye=&eye=&col=all&maxcount=50
From the Quaritch catalogue: "Taylor appears to have been a musician – the Bodleian Library holds a number of songs and anthems composed by him, published between 1903 and 1934 – and he clearly took a great interest in Arabic music."
Arrangement
Album, oblong 8vo (18.2 x 24.5 cm), pp. [2], 48; printed title 'The interchangeable photo-scrap album no trimming or mounting required' (London, M.W. & Co.), 48 black and white glossy prints (10.5 x 15.5 cm).
